com.tomtom.speedtools.time

Class UTCTime

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.tomtom.speedtools.time.UTCTime

  • public final class UTCTime
extends Object
    Utility class for UTC time usage. Date/time value created with this class are always time zoned UTC.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static org.joda.time.DateTime MAX_TIMESTAMP_DATE 
      static org.joda.time.DateTime MIN_TIMESTAMP_DATE

    • Method Detail

      • now

        @Nonnull
public static org.joda.time.DateTime now()
        Return 'now' as UTC DateTime. Using this 'now' versus DateTime.now() has the advantage of making sure you always read/write UTC time-zoned times.
        Returns:
        Now, with time zone '+000'.

      • from

        @Nonnull
public static org.joda.time.DateTime from(@Nonnull
                                                   org.joda.time.DateTime time)
        Return time in time zone UTC.
        Parameters:
        time - Source time, Joda time.
        Returns:
        Same time in UTC time.

      • from

        @Nonnull
public static org.joda.time.DateTime from(@Nonnull
                                                   Date time)
        Return time in time zone UTC.
        Parameters:
        time - Source time, Java time.
        Returns:
        Same time in UTC time.

      • parse

        @Nonnull
public static org.joda.time.DateTime parse(@Nonnull
                                                    String str)
        Parses a DateTime from the specified string. This uses ISODateTimeFormat.dateTimeParser().
        Parameters:
        str - the string to parse, not null.
        Returns:
        UTC time.

      • dateTimeToUTCTimestamp

        public static int dateTimeToUTCTimestamp(@Nonnull
                                         org.joda.time.DateTime dateTime)
        Returns a timestamp that corresponds to the given date. The minimum representable time is 1901-12-13T20:45:54Z, and the maximum representable time is 2038-01-19T03:14:07Z.
        Parameters:
        dateTime - The date to convert.
        Returns:
        The timestamp that corresponds to the given date.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - In case the given date is not within the minimum MIN_TIMESTAMP_DATE and maximum MAX_TIMESTAMP_DATE.
